body:
### Describe the bug

An edge case with the walrus operator + raise inside try/except doesn't compile. I am porting existing tested production code to cython and found a subset of walrus operators could not compile due to this issue

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
async def fails_in_try():
    """
    Error on line 34: local variable 'x' referenced before assignment
    """
    try:
        if not (x := await get_value()):
            raise ValueError("Not found")

        return x["key"]  # <-- Cython thinks x might be unassigned
    except Exception:
        pass
```


### Expected behaviour

No error should be raised.

### OS

Ubuntu 25.10

### Python version

Python 3.13

### Cython version

Cython 3.2.4

### Additional context

```python
# =============================================================================
# WORKS: Same pattern outside try/except
# =============================================================================
async def works_outside_try():
    """This compiles fine - Cython correctly tracks the raise terminates flow."""
    if not (x := await get_value()):
        raise ValueError("Not found")

    return x["key"]  # <-- Cython knows x is assigned here


# =============================================================================
# WORKS: Separate assignment from condition workaround
# =============================================================================
async def workaround():
    """Separating assignment from condition works around the bug."""
    try:
        x = await get_value()
        if not x:
            raise ValueError("Not found")

        return x["key"]
    except Exception:
        pass
```
title: [BUG] Cython flow analysis bug: walrus operator + raise inside try/except
